alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 7:29PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Weld County through 800 PM MDT... At 729 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hereford to 3 miles northwest of Purcell, or along a line extending from 29 miles southeast of Cheyenne to 18 miles north of Greeley. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Grover, Keota and Hereford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Northeast Weld County
